revised_title: Iron, Cobalt, and Nickel Carbide-Carbonyl Clusters Formation via CO Scission
tldr: The authors discovered a new method for synthesizing iron, cobalt, and nickel carbide-carbonyl clusters by cleaving CO molecules. This approach may be significant for the formation of surface carbide atoms on metal crystallites. The researchers synthesized various carbide clusters using different reactions and techniques, providing insights into the structure and properties of these compounds.
